text: RT @TexAgs Mood all week http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1067167687158095872/pu/img/g_kUQk-8SP2Aw3MT.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1067167687158095872/pu/vid/320x180/vqv-oisXkmyGkNZm.mp4?tag=5

Today was a big day. The Senate woke up. The Senate said we aren’t going to keep turning a blind eye to Saudi Arabia abuses or their war in Yemen. The Senate advanced the bill to stop U.S involvement in this war. Full debate and votes likely next week.

The ugly truth is that by continuing to enable Saudi Arabia, the US is complicit in the devastation in Yemen. S.J. Res 54 will help us hold our allies – and ourselves – accountable.
 
I’m proud to have been an early co-sponsor. I’ll keep fighting to end US support for this war. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DtHpTzGXcAE0u1Y.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1067850958892355584/vid/320x180/lWL3uTST7_K1KbP1.mp4?tag=8

Some places across the country are seeing decreasing insurance premiums and more choices. Only 17 more days until the Affordable Care Act open enrollment ends (California has until January 15), so be sure to visit http://healthcare.gov to get covered. 
https://twitter.com/NPR/status/1066008473790345217 QT @NPR Memphis and Phoenix, as in many parts of the U.S., are experiencing something unprecedented: Insurance premiums are sinking and choices are sprouting. https://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2018/11/23/667466242/many-who-buy-aca-health-plans-for-2019-find-lower-prices-and-more-choice?utm_source=twitter.com&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=npr&utm_term=nprnews&utm_content=2052

RT @CBSNews GM will save $4.5 billion by cutting 14,000 jobs and closing five factories. 

But according to SEC filings, the company spent more than twice that much buying back its own stock.

And it did that when the economy was weaker than it is today. https://www.cbsnews.com/news/gm-bought-back-10-billion-in-stock-since-2015-double-what-job-cuts-will-save/?ftag=CNM-00-10aab7e&linkId=60255394 http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DtDh0ExWsAABMCR.jpg

Do not forget: it was a U.S. bomb that killed 40 children on a school bus in Yemen in August—some of the many thousands of civilians who have died in this horrific, Saudi-led war.

The Senate must vote today to end our support for these atrocities.

#StopFarr https://twitter.com/SenateDems/status/1067494840877924358 QT @SenateDems Thomas Farr should never be a federal judge. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1067488786538553344/img/jG4L-LSpNV9HHkQE.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1067488786538553344/vid/320x180/4oPqFSufu1PIBW22.mp4?tag=8
